alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 9:34AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT/1245 PM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin and Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Bay and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT /1245 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 AM CDT /934 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carrabelle, Apalachicola, Eastpoint, Port St. Joe, St George Island, Mexico Beach, Wewahitchka, Stonemill Creek, Tyndall Air Force Base, Orange, Franklin, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Buck Siding, Fort Gadsden, Beverly, Hays Place, Sumatra and Dalkeith. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
